page.title: 17FRAN BOX-A day in the life 2
page.content: The childrens' bedtime is around 7pm. Martin,leaves Bedales at 6.30,8.30 or 10.30pm depending on his duties for the day.(Bedales is an independent, residential, coeducational secondary school in Steep).Evenings at home are spent doing chores,reading, watching TV,and for Martin, doing work for his Open University Degree.When possible Martin and Fran try to find time to continue doing improvements to their house.The two cottages knocked into one provide excellent accomodation.5 bedrooms,3 living rooms,1 kitchen,1 bathroom, and a shower/cloakroom. At the front of the cottages is a fine old well with a working pump, and at the rear two Edwardian washhouses each with a stone sink and fireplace. Fran and Martin are very pleased with the improvements so far, but admit that they are never ending. Finally to bed!
